Tajweed Rules Qalqala (Echoing) Iqlab (Assimilation/Flipping) Idgham (Elision/Merging) Idgham without Ghunna "Ikhfa\'a (Lenition/Hiding)" Ghunna (Nasalisation) Must Stop found 22 times Better to stop found 603 times Pause at one found 12 times A slight pause found 7 times Stop or Continue found 1972 times Better to continue found 1682 times Dont Stop found 68 times %1$d times %1$d sec %1$d secs
-->
Any نّ or مّ will have a sound that emanates from the nose. Any نْ or ً ٍ ٌ followed by any of these letters ك ق ف ظ ط ض ص ش س ز ذ د ج ث ت will be pronounced with a slight nasal sound\n\nOR\n\nWhen the letter ب appears after a مْ it will be pronounced with a light nasal sound in the nose. Any نْ or ً ٍ ٌ followed by any of these letters و م ن ي will become assimilated into the following letter and will be read with Ghunna\n\nOR\n\nWhen a مْ is followed by مّ, the former will become incorporated into the latter and will be read with Ghunna. Any نْ or ً ٍ ٌ followed by the letter ل or ر will become assimilated into the following letter but the ghunna will not be pronounced. Any نْ or ً ٍ ٌ followed by ب will change into a م. Any of these five letters د ج ب ط ق when encountered with a Sukun ْ &or as the last letter of the verse need to be recited with a slight echoing or jerking sound. Using transliteration for reading/writing Quran is not proper way. As it may lead to wrong pronunciation, and discourage to learn proper Tajweed. Check for more @ https://islamqa.info/en/191497 \n\n We should remember that Allah(swt) will give us double reward for trying to learn proper recitation in sha Allah [Bukhari 4937].\n\n You can learn from a Shaykh / \'Alim / \'Qari of your locality, which is preferable if possible.\n If it is not possible, you can try learning from these sites:\n
1. http://www.iou-gqmc.com/tajweed-programs/ \n
2. http://www.searchtruth.com/quran_teacher/quran.php \n
Alternatively, you can download the recitation by Shaykh Ayman Suwaid / Shaykh Minshawi / Shaykh Husary from our app, and listen to their recitations in case you want to check a pronunciation. Also you may learn from their recitations, how to recite with tajweed properly in sha Allah. We may remove this transliteration in future in sha Allah, as it is our mistake as well. \n May Allah make it easy for all of us, and forgive our shortcomings. I Agree Warning!! Recitations Mujawwad Mujawwad is a melodic style of Quran recitation Murattal Murattal is at a slower pace, used for study and practice Muallim Muallim is teaching style recitation of Quran Translation is audio translation of the Quran WBW Supports word by word audio highlighting
